content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) producing {'iron-plate': 43} with warning: no ingredients to smelt  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0) with warnings: out of fuel; output blocked by item on the ground  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) with warning: out of fuel; pickup at (–15.5, –49.5) and drop at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5) holding {'iron-ore': 146}  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) with status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS; pickup at (–15.5, –47.5) and drop at (–13.5, –47.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5) with warning: not receiving electricity  
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) with warning: not connected to power network

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) with warning: no ingredients to smelt

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5) with lab_input: {'automation-science-pack': 23}  
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5) (WORKING)  
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) (WORKING) connected to the Boiler  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) with warnings: out of fuel; no input liquid; no fluid present in connections  
– Generator (Steam Engine) at (2.5, 27.5) with warnings: no input liquid; no fluid present in connections  
Note: The fluid connection from the Boiler to the Steam Engine remains unresolved due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5).

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5) with warnings: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate (1)  
– Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
– Distributed Small Electric Poles forming the power network

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189393) spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189398) at approximately (8.5, 5.5) with 2 pipe segments  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189399) at approximately (10.5, 4.5) with multiple segments  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189404) linking offshore pump at (–9.5, 24.5) with a series of pipes toward the Boiler  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189407) at (2.5, 9.5) with a short chain of connections  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189408) at (10.5, 9.5) with secondary pipe routing  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189414) at (1.5, 11.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189429) at (–1.5, 17.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189430) at (0.5, 17.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189432) at (6.5, 16.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189437) at (–1.5, 21.5) – potential congestion point  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189446) at (4.5, 25.5) with several pipe segments

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting relevant inserter and belt outputs (6 belts total)  
– Electricity network via:  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57159) with poles at [ (–10.5, –49.5), (–12.5, –48.5), (–12.5, –50.5) ]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57162) with poles spanning positions near (3.5, 0.5) and surrounding areas  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57172) with poles at [ (6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5) ]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57174) with poles at [ (2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5) ]

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion  
 – Persistent congestion near the Boiler’s lower connection at (2.5, 21.5) continues to block the fluid pathway between the Boiler and the Steam Engine.  
 – Numerous pipe groups and interfering entities lead to collisions despite candidate directions (RIGHT, UP, LEFT, DOWN) with spacings (2, 3, 4).  
 – Mitigation: Reconfigure or relocate obstructing pipe groups; upgrade to underground pipelines or use pipe-to-ground modules; reroute the fluid connection to a less congested region.

• Fuel, Resource, and Electricity Supply Issues  
 – Multiple entities (e.g., Burner Mining Drills, Burner Inserters, Furnaces, Assembling Machines) display warnings regarding fuel shortages, missing input ingredients, or inadequate electrical connectivity.  
 – Mitigation: Maintain regular fuel and resource replenishment; expand and reinforce the power network to ensure consistent supply.

• Entity Placement and Collision Conflicts  
 – Repeated collision warnings indicate insufficient spacing among pipe groups and other entities.  
 – Mitigation: Verify that placement tiles are unoccupied and maintain adequate separation before placing entities to avoid collisions.
